page.title: 10ARMED FORCES (ARMY)
page.content: The area is owned mainly by the Ministry of Defence as it is the northern edge of Salisbury Plain which is used for army training. The Plain's outer edge is let to farmers as Schedule 1 or Schedule 3 land; Schedule 3 abuts training areas and no compensation can be claimed for any damage by tanks, troops,guns, etc.The public have no access beyond certain points which are well defined.This does protect and encourage certain wildlife.The army practises the firing of all kinds of weapons and there is considerable infantry training using live ammunition.Part of Tenantry Down is enclosed by high banks topped by hedges,known as boscage,to simulate the Normandy landscape.The troops using the Imber Ranges are stationed at the School of Infantry,Warminster.
